intro: Elaeosticta kuramensis, commonly known as the Kuram mountain bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of eastern Turkey. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky and well-drained soils at higher altitudes. It has hairy leaves and stems, which help it withstand the harsh climatic conditions of its habitat. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
